intro: Nephelium beccarianum, commonly known as the beccarian mangostan, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces a fruit with a thick, segmented rind and a sweet, aromatic pulp. It thrives in humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
